title: Business & Finance
text:
Walt Disney said it plans to make cuts to marketing and content budgets after the company reported weaker-than-expected earnings for the fourth quarter.

---

Meta Platforms will begin laying off employees on Wednesday morning, Zuckerberg told executives, saying he was accountable for the company's missteps.

---

Signs are mounting that Japan, for years one of the biggest buyers of U.S. Treasurys, is selling short-term U.S. bonds as part of an effort to prop up the yen.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes notched gains, with the S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq rising 0.6%, 1% and 0.5%, respectively.

---

Kohl's chief Gass will leave the department-store chain to join Levi Strauss with plans to have her take over as the jeans maker's CEO.

---

Musk sold almost $4 billion in Tesla stock after completing the $44 billion purchase of Twitter, according to regulatory disclosures.

---

Microsoft faces an antitrust complaint from a European industry group over its cloud services, adding to allegations of anticompetitive behavior against the firm.
